title: UCMAS vs Soroban App – Detailed Comparison of Cost, Time, and Results
description: Complete comparison of UCMAS vs Soroban online: $100-200/month vs $10-15/month, driving to centers vs learning at home, certificates vs flexibility. Comparison table and 5 questions to help you decide.
imageAlt: Parent researching UCMAS vs Soroban app options on laptop

content.intro: I heard about UCMAS first. Saw videos of kids calculating 10 numbers in 5 seconds – I was amazed. About to sign up when I discovered Soroban online apps – same method but through an app, 5-10x cheaper. I spent 2 weeks comparing in detail. The results surprised me.

sections.text: What is UCMAS?
UCMAS (Universal Concept of Mental Arithmetic System) is a proprietary mental math program using the abacus, originating from Malaysia in 1993. Currently present in 80+ countries.
How UCMAS Works

items: Learn at centers: 2 sessions/week, 2 hours each
Teachers trained and certified by UCMAS
Globally standardized materials
Regular level exams (with international certificates)
Homework practice with paper worksheets at home

sections.text: Strengths of UCMAS

items: **Standardized curriculum:** Clear pathway from Level 1 to Level 10
**International certificates:** Recognized in 80+ countries
**In-person teachers:** Someone to guide and correct immediately
**Learning environment:** Friends, competition, motivation
**International competitions:** Opportunity to join mental arithmetic contests

sections.text: What is Soroban Online?
Soroban online also teaches mental math using the Soroban abacus, but through APP or website. Kids learn at home, anytime, with guidance from software.
How It Works

items: Learn through app on phone/tablet/computer
Video tutorials + interactive exercises
Choose your own learning time (10-20 minutes/day)
Automatic progress tracking system
Gamification: points, levels, virtual rewards

sections.text: Strengths of Soroban Online

items: **Time flexibility:** Learn anytime, anywhere
**Low cost:** 5-10x cheaper than centers
**No commuting:** Save parents' time
**Self-paced:** Kids learn at their own rhythm, no pressure
**Gamification:** Kids enjoy learning because it feels like gaming

sections.text: Detailed Comparison: UCMAS vs Soroban Online
5 Questions to Help You Decide
1. Can you drive to class 2 times per week?
YES → UCMAS works. NO → Soroban online is more convenient.
2. What's your budget?
$100-200/month is OK → UCMAS. Want under $15/month → Soroban online.
3. Do you need international certificates?
Need certificates for college apps, scholarships → UCMAS. Just need the skill → Both work.
4. Does your child prefer group or self-learning?
Likes having friends, competition → UCMAS. Prefers self-learning, no pressure → Soroban online.
5. Is your child self-motivated?
Needs someone supervising → UCMAS. Self-motivated → Both work.
My biggest worry with online was: without a teacher, can they learn on their own? But after trying, I found my kids prefer learning through the app – because it feels like playing a game.
My Decision
After comparing, I chose Soroban online with Sorokid. Reasons:

items: **Our situation:** Both my wife and I work full-time, can't drive to class 2× per week
**Cost:** $15/month is easier to maintain than $200. For us, $15 × 24 months = $360 (vs $4,800 for UCMAS)
**Kids liked it:** My kids focus better with the app – games, points, 'leveling up'
**Don't need certificates:** I just want them to do mental math, no credentials needed

sections.text: Results After 5 Months

items: They can mentally calculate 2-digit numbers (34 + 57, 82 - 45)
Not as fast as UCMAS promotional videos, but clear progress compared to before
They OPEN the app themselves every evening, no reminders needed
Evenings are lighter – no rushing to pick up/drop off

sections.text: I don't regret my choice. If later they want advanced training or international competitions, I can consider UCMAS. But for now, Soroban online is enough.
UCMAS and Soroban online teach THE SAME SKILL – mental math with abacus. Choose based on your family situation. Neither is absolutely 'better.'

faq.question: Are UCMAS and Soroban the same thing?
faq.answer: Both teach mental math using abacus. Difference: UCMAS is a PROGRAM with proprietary rights, learned at centers, with certificates. Soroban online is a METHOD, learned through apps, no international certificates.

faq.question: How much is the cost difference?
faq.answer: UCMAS: $100-200/month + materials + exam fees = about $2,400-4,800 for 2 years. Soroban online: $10-15/month = $240-360 for 2 years. Difference of 5-10x.

faq.question: Are learning outcomes different?
faq.answer: Final skill is the same: mental math. UCMAS might be FASTER due to in-person teachers and exam pressure. Soroban online is MORE FLEXIBLE, but requires self-motivation.

faq.question: What's the value of UCMAS certificates?
faq.answer: Recognized in 80+ countries. Can add to college applications, scholarship portfolios. But if you only need mental math skills, certificates aren't required.

faq.question: My child is already at UCMAS. Should we switch to online?
faq.answer: If your child is progressing well at UCMAS, no need to switch. If facing difficulties (cost, time), you can switch to online to maintain skills.

faq.question: Is Soroban online suitable for hyperactive kids?
faq.answer: May be harder without in-person teachers maintaining discipline. But apps have gamification (games, points) that can hold attention. Try and see how your child responds.

faq.question: How long until we see results?
faq.answer: UCMAS: 2-3 months for simple mental math, 1-2 years for mastery. Soroban online: similar timeline but may be slower if child isn't self-motivated.

faq.question: Can we do both?
faq.answer: Possible but not recommended. Same method, learning in 2 places is redundant. Choose 1 and learn until mastery.

faq.question: How is Sorokid different from UCMAS?
faq.answer: Sorokid is an APP for learning Soroban online. Different from UCMAS: learn at home (no center trips), cost 5-10x lower, no international certificates, flexible schedule.

faq.question: What if I choose wrong?
faq.answer: No problem. If UCMAS doesn't fit, you can stop and switch to online. If online isn't effective, you can try a center. The important thing is to TRY.
